posts.post_content: Unlike [Helix Pinnacle](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Helix Pinnacle), you can DOUBLE the charge counters on this using my favorite card out of Eventide: **[Gilder Bairn](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gilder Bairn)**. Since [Helix Pinnacle](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Helix Pinnacle) has Shroud it isn't a target for [Gilder Bairn](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gilder Bairn)'s untap ability, but with [Doubling Season](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Doubling Season) + [Gilder Bairn](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gilder Bairn) you're tripling the charge counters on it each turn.
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
I was just playing a multiplayer game, with a deck I had just constructed, at one point I mentioned that the deck had no creatures in it, one of my opponents asked me "how will you win then?"  
at that point I realized the deck had absolutely no win condition, though it was extrodinary at stalling the game and keeping myself alive.  
  
I think I just found my win condition.

Posted By: supershawn (5/24/2011 5:52:41 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Interesting - one of only two cards that have non-time-restricted "you win the game" conditions (discounting [The Cheese Stands Alone](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=The Cheese Stands Alone)), the other being [Coalition Victory](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Coalition Victory). All the other alternate win condition cards only check at the beginning of your upkeep.  
  
I assume in a Grand Melee event, each group of people who came into your range of influence would lose the game in turn, barring someone having a [Platinum Angel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Platinum Angel) out.
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
Actually, it is tripling.  
  
Let's say it has 3 counters. Gilder bairn goes "I'll put 3 counters on it". Doubling season says "no, no, 6". 3+6 is 9. 9 is 3 tripled. I see why you thought it was 2x2, but that's not how it works.
posts.html:
Actually, it is tripling.

Let's say it has 3 counters. Gilder bairn goes "I'll put 3 counters on it". Doubling season says "no, no, 6". 3+6 is 9. 9 is 3 tripled. I see why you thought it was 2x2, but that's not how it works.

Posted By: Arachnos (4/13/2012 11:42:53 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
So, why didn't the Mirrans just use **this** against the Phyrexians?  
Something tells me it's a bit of a challenge to fling a giant, flying rock [Into the Core](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Into the Core)...  
  
As a fan of winning by any means other than damage, I find this card to be amusing.  
  
I love building creatureless decks, and this gives an additional wincon other than milling.  
I \*love\* the fact that it's Indestructible, leaving precious few methods of removing it (mostly bounce and exile)-  
they pretty much just have to watch the counters build while they fret helplessly.  
  
This is hilarious in EDH, but *do not* cast it without a small army to defend yourself against every other player on the table.
posts.html:
So, why didn't the Mirrans just use this against the Phyrexians?
Something tells me it's a bit of a challenge to fling a giant, flying rock Into the Core...

As a fan of winning by any means other than damage, I find this card to be amusing.

I love building creatureless decks, and this gives an additional wincon other than milling.
I *love* the fact that it's Indestructible, leaving precious few methods of removing it (mostly bounce and exile)-
they pretty much just have to watch the counters build while they fret helplessly.

This is hilarious in EDH, but do not cast it without a small army to defend yourself against every other player on the table.

posts.post_content:
Been there, done that.  
1) Be attacked by a [Blightsteel Colossus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Blightsteel Colossus), with a second one had just been [shaped](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=194201).  
2) Tutor two [Galvanizers](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=220364) with [Myr Turbine](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Myr Turbine) and [Voltaic Key](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Voltaic Key) mid-combat.  
3) Block [Colossus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=221563) with pumped Myr tokens, surviving with 9 poison counters.  
4) Cast the [Reactor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=43548)  
5) [Mana myr](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=194378), two [Galvanizers](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=220364) and [Coretapper](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Coretapper)  
6) ???  
7) PROFIT!!!  
  
Most epic moment evar.  
  
As for the flavor of it, remember that already-processed and shaped darksteel is indestructible? As the art shows clearly, the usual orbs of light normally circling around darksteel are being concentrated and compressed in the center of the [Reactor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=43548). As time... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
